Metal, Black Metal, Death Metal, Heavy Metal
Auto - While on Wifi, stream audio at a high quality bitrate. When on a cellular connection, stream at a lower bitrate.

WREK is the entirely student managed, operated and engineered radio station at Georgia Tech in Atlanta. WREK broadcasts 24 hours a day from the Georgia Tech Student Center on 91.1 FM with 100,000 watts throughout Atlanta. The station also broadcasts a divsersity of its current programming on an HD subchannel. The station offers its air signal online in addition to a two week mp3 archive of all recorded shows.

WREK has been broadcasting since March 25th, 1968. Broadcasting from the top of the Van Leer Electrical Engineering building, the first song played over the air was "Spooky" by the Classics IV. Years later, the station moved to the offices adjacent to the Alexander Memorial Coliseum where it stayed until 2008 when it moved to the newly remodelled Student Center.

Since then, names, faces, and clothing fashions may have changed, but the station-wide philosophy of providing diverse, quality programming to the Atlanta area and the world at large has remained unwavering.

In 1994, WREK became one of the first radio stations to stream its air signal over the Internet.
Follow WREK on the web: www.wrek.org
The primary content of this application including streamed audio, station emblems, logos, and show descriptions are copyright WREK Atlanta and the Georgia Institute of Technology.
